sentences.english: the massive foot stomps down where he just was.
sentences.chinese: 机甲硕大的脚重重地踏在他刚才的位置上。

sentences.english: He had troubles with the very elements of writing.
sentences.chinese: 他在掌握写作的基本要领方面困难重重。

sentences.english: For all its troubles, it seems that the US is still the real Middle Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 尽管危机重重，美国似乎仍是真正的“中央王国”。

sentences.english: It flamed out and fell heavily on the table.
sentences.chinese: 那机器人最终喷出火花重重地摔在桌面上。

sentences.english: I bent down and so did he, and we bashed heads.
sentences.chinese: 我弯下身子，他也一样，我们的头重重地碰在了一起。

sentences.english: He overcomes the odds and defeats the unscrupulous enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他克服了重重困难，最终战胜了疯狂的敌人。

sentences.english: Dad took the fiddle to the telephone and thumped the strings.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸把小提琴拿到话机旁，重重地拨弄了几下琴弦。

sentences.english: The heavy bag made the chair broken.
sentences.chinese: 这个重重的包把椅子压坏了。

sentences.english: He reeled back when the heavy blow landed on his head.
sentences.chinese: 他的头受此重重一击，使他向后打了个趔趄。

sentences.english: I can see that you have something weighs heavily on your mind.
sentences.chinese: 他最近看起来心事重重的。你知道他有什么心事吗？

sentences.english: Every dusk, mother would waddles home with a heavy sack on her back.
sentences.chinese: 每天黄昏，母亲都背着重重的袋子蹒跚而归。

sentences.english: The oil station collapsed due to heavy snows.
sentences.chinese: 整个油站因抵受不住重重的积雪而倒塌。

sentences.english: Yan Liu gradually back heavy, Humilis cloud Lone Wild Goose far red winter sunset days.
sentences.chinese: 回头烟柳渐重重，淡云孤雁远，寒日暮天红。

sentences.english: So how does the neophyte collector find his or her way through this jungle?
sentences.chinese: 收藏新手们如何在这重重森林中找对路子呢？

sentences.english: The chairman prefaced his remarks with some sharp raps on the table.
sentences.chinese: 主席重重地敲了几下桌子，然后开始讲话。

definition: to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
loudly/with a loud bang/a loud rumble
to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
be high up in the sky
to beat with the fist/to hammer/to cudgel
to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
